This talk will cover various forms of threats that the electronic chip supply chain is up against, as well as defenses against these threats. The talk will elucidate the development of CAD algorithms/tools for this newly emerging field by mostly leveraging principles from other more mature research domains.

title: Polarization Controller for Si photonic integrated circuits with an active closed loop control
conferenceTitle: ECOC 2016; 42nd European Conference on Optical Communication
abstract: A polarization insensitive silicon photonic circuit for the management of any arbitrary polarization state of light coming from a fiber linked to a remote source is demonstrated. WDM channels with a common arbitrary polarization at the input are automatically equalized.

title: Search the optimal combination of the geometric parameters of the ring magnet with a trapezoidal cross-section
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Conference on Actual Problems of Electron Devices Engineering (APEDE)
abstract: The article attempted to calculate the optimal combination of geometric parameters of an annular magnet with trapezoid cross-section. For this results value of the magnetic induction was calculated for a magnet with a trapezoidal cross-section with different thicknesses and different combinations of geometric parameters. The dependence, according to which one of the best combinations of geometric parameters of the magnet with a trapezoidal cross-section is a magnet with large thickness.

title: Classification and diagnosis of the parkinson disease by stacked autoencoder
conferenceTitle: 2016 National Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Biomedical Engineering (ELECO)
abstract: Parkinson disease is neuro-degenerative motion disorder this disease causes voice and speech dysfunctions. Therefore, disease can be diagnosed by determining dysphonia produced by a subject with parkinson diseases. In this paper we have introduced a new classification method of the parkinson disease which is based on the stacked autoencoder. The method is tested with two data sets and results show that the performance of the stacked autoencoder is significantly better than the-state-art-methods.

title: High-frequency and high-efficiency bidirectional DC-DC converter for electric vehicle supercapacitor systems
conferenceTitle: 6th Hybrid and Electric Vehicles Conference (HEVC 2016)
abstract: A high-efficiency bidirectional DC-DC converter for electric vehicle supercapacitor systems is presented. Compared with traditional IGBT power devices, wide bandgap devices can be effective here, but cost and technical issues such as gate oxide reliability are seen as drawbacks. A potentially attractive alternative device is the silicon super-junction MOSFET. However, the behaviour of the intrinsic diode and output capacitance of this device is problematic. An external diode network can be used to provide intrinsic diode deactivation. The selection of these diodes and their interaction with the device output capacitances is investigated. The proposed circuitry is demonstrated in a 1.1kW converter operating from 400V and switching at between 50kHz and 125kHz.

title: 40 dB-Rejection Sharp-Edge Integrated SOI Phase-Shifted Bragg Grating Filter for Microwave Photonics
conferenceTitle: ECOC 2016; 42nd European Conference on Optical Communication
abstract: An integrated, high-order phase-shifted Bragg-grating realizing steep-sloped optical passband filter with measured 41.5 dB out-of-band rejection and a transition bandwidth roll-off of 288 GHz/nm is demonstrated in passive Silicon-on-Insulator technology and verified in two different microwave photonics applications.

title: NATO Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence
conferenceTitle: 2016 8th International Conference on Cyber Conflict (CyCon)
abstract: The Tallinn-based NATO Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence (NATO CCD COE) is a NATO-accredited knowledge hub, think-tank and training facility. The international military organisation focuses on interdisciplinary applied research and development, as well as consultations, trainings and exercises in the field of cyber security. The Centre's mission is to enhance capability, cooperation and information-sharing between NATO, Allies and partners in cyber defence.

title: DE optimized TIDF controller for LFC of interconnected power system
conferenceTitle: International Conference on Recent Trends in Engineering, Science & Technology - (ICRTEST 2016)
abstract: This paper presents comparative performance analysis of Differential Evolution (DE) algorithm optimized classical controllers i.e. Integral (I), Proportional-Integral (PI) and Proportional-Integral-Derivative (PID) controller with a new Tilt-Integral-Derivative with derivative filter (TIDF) controller for load frequency control. Here, a five unequal reheat thermal area with generation rate constraint (GRC) and Governor Dead Band (GDB) non-linearity is considered for study. The gains of above controllers are optimized using the Integral of Time multiplied by Absolute Error (ITAE) objective function. The simulation results show that the TIDF controller provides better dynamic performance than classical controllers.

title: Three-level hybrid boost converter with high voltage gain
conferenceTitle: 4th IET Clean Energy and Technology Conference (CEAT 2016)
abstract: This paper presents a three-level hybrid boost converter based on T-type neutral point clamped inverter. The main advantage of the proposed converter is the capability of high voltage conversion ratio without using extreme duty cycle, high-frequency transformer, and coupled inductor. The performance of the proposed three-level hybrid boost converter has been simulated using PLECS software.

title: Application of local autonomous protection against voltage instability to IEEE test system
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting (PESGM)
abstract: Summary form only given. This paper summarizes an instability monitoring and protection method based on local identification of global voltage instability (LIVES) and applies it to an IEEE test system for voltage stability and security assessment. The identification method (LIVES-alarm) is tested with both detailed and Quasi-Steady-State simulation tools, and two protection schemes, based respectively on reverse Load Tap Changer operation (LIVES-restore) and firm load shedding, are evaluated and compared using the unstable scenario provided with the test system. The effect of load sensitivity to voltage is also investigated.

title: Building the quietest space on earth: Precision optical systems for advanced LIGO
conferenceTitle: 2016 Conference on Lasers and Electro-Optics (CLEO)
abstract: Summary form only given. The recent detection of gravitational waves was made possible by the finest laser interferometers ever built. I will describe Advanced LIGO's optics, isolation, and control systems and discuss how the recent upgrades have changed our ability to ‚Äúlisten‚Äù to the universe.

title: Application of ANP in selection of converters for wave farm systems
conferenceTitle: International Conference on Recent Trends in Engineering, Science & Technology - (ICRTEST 2016)
abstract: The present study is an attempt to propose an objective methodology to identify suitable converters for the utilizing as wave farms so that optimal utilization under minimum constraints can be achieved. In this aspect analytical network process (ANP) was utilized for the first time to select the converters for using in wave farms in a specific location so that maximum utilization of ocean energy can be possible. In total twenty one parameters were used to select more suitable converters for using in wave farm. The objectivity of the method provides as reliable methodology for selection of converters.

title: PDM-QPSK WDM Signal Amplification Using PPLN-Based Polarization-Independent In-Line Phase-Sensitive Amplifier
conferenceTitle: ECOC 2016; 42nd European Conference on Optical Communication
abstract: We demonstrate the in-line phase-sensitive amplification of PDM-QPSK WDM signals. The amplifier consists of PPLN waveguides and has a net gain of 12 dB. These signals are transmitted over 80 km by recovering the pilot tone.

title: Full-Channel Parallel Measurement of 4x20-Gb/s All-Optical OFDM Signals by Using Loop-Assisted Coherent Matched Detector
conferenceTitle: ECOC 2016; 42nd European Conference on Optical Communication
abstract: We demonstrate measurement of 4x20-Gb/s all-optical OFDM signals by using loop-assisted coherent matched detector. All-optical OFDM signal is projected onto the time-frequency domain first; then, all sub-channels are restored through digital matrix processing, without relying on optical FFT.

title: Plenary lectures
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Conference on Signals and Electronic Systems (ICSES)
abstract: Provides an abstract for each of the plenary presentations and may include a brief professional biography of each presenter. The complete presentations were not made available for publication as part of the conference proceedings.

title: Rhythmic spontaneous UPE in seedlings ‚Äî overview
conferenceTitle: 2016 Progress in Electromagnetic Research Symposium (PIERS)
abstract: Summary form only given. The rhythmic features found in the spontaneous ultra-weak photon emission from seedlings, in the early stages of development, will be presented and discussed based in the results of past 10 years with wheat, corn and sunflower seeds. Synchronism with external triggers such gravimetric tide and geomagnetic cycles are studied and might give indications for further applications in chronobiology and agriculture.

title: Study of information integration architecture based on the extensibility of smart gird CIM model
conferenceTitle: CIRED Workshop 2016
abstract: This study extends IEC 61970 and IEC 61968 series standard on common information model(CIM). An information integration framework model of smart grid has been proposed' which includes electricity generation' transmission' distribution and consumption. Modeling of distributed energy put forward a unified information modeling specification and information communication standard. It provides a basis to support interconnection and interoperability' which also facilitates seamless access and coordinated control.

title: PhD and doctorate consortium
conferenceTitle: 2016 11th International Conference for Internet Technology and Secured Transactions (ICITST)
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. The complete presentation was not made available for publication as part of the conference proceedings. The idea of writing a research paper or developing a topic of research interest that can lead to a PhD / Doctorate degree or proposal is always an endless thinking of where, when, why, what and who. Therefore, becoming an experienced researcher and writer in any field or discipline takes a great deal of practice. The Consortium has the following objectives: ‚Ä¢ Provide a supportive setting for feedback on current research that will stimulate exchange of ideas; ‚Ä¢ Guide on the future research directions; ‚Ä¢ Promote the development of a supportive community of scholars and a spirit of collaborative research; ‚Ä¢ Contribute to the conference goals through interaction with other researchers and conference events.

title: Spectroscopic study of impurity ion radial distribution in an advanced beam-driven field reversed configuration
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE International Conference on Plasma Science (ICOPS)
abstract: Summary form only given. Impurity ion spectra ranging from vacuum ultra violet (vuv) to visible wavelengths was observed in an advanced beam-driven field-reversed configuration (FRC) plasmas1. Main impurity spectral lines were identified and modeled with the help of the collisional-radiative code NOMAD2. Impurity concentrations were estimated, based on the modeling results. Radial distribution of impurity charge states was reconstructed for the first time in an FRC experiment. Analysis of vuv spectra revealed quite low Zeff both inside and outside the FRC separatrix.

title: High-Q photonic crystal nanobeam cavities on silicon
conferenceTitle: 2016 Progress in Electromagnetic Research Symposium (PIERS)
abstract: Photonic crystal (PhC) nanobeam cavities have attracted increasing attention owing to the advantages of high Q-factor, small mode volume and no limitation of FSR. Various PhC cavities have been developed for optical communications, optical sensors, optomechanics, etc.. We investigate the design, fabrication, and experimental characterization of high quality factor PhCnanobeam cavities on silicon. The results show that PhCnanobeam cavities have the potential to ful?ll the aforementioned requirements and form a building block for achieving on-chip optical filtering and sensing applications.

title: New bibliometric analysis of research institutions network
conferenceTitle: 2016 Portland International Conference on Management of Engineering and Technology (PICMET)
abstract: To understand academic research, bibliometric analysis is tremendously important at any aspects. Research institutions such as university, institution and research center, are focal point of academic research. We have used simple and quantitative bibliometric analysis for the evaluation of research institutions. Nowadays some study show qualitative and network-based bibliometric analysis has been implemented for this purpose as a new approach. As such a new approach, this research shows network-based bibliometric analysis to understand research institutions characteristics qualitatively and show new standard for the evaluation of research institutions, using co-authorship analysis. As a result and discussion, we suggested some network index may represent their institutions' academic situation and power on their field and country.

title: Oscillistor RF-converter resistance to frequency
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The characteristics of silicon oscillistor sensors with frequency output and oscillistor resistance-tofrequency converter (RF-converter) are discussed. The prospects oscillistor RF-converter for producing on its basis the various sensors with frequency output when the sensing element is a photo-, magnetic-, tenso-, thermo-, or variable resistor (linear and angular motion sensor), and converter resistance-to-frequency will be oscillistor.

title: Improvement of bodipy-based bulk heterojunction solar cell using 1,8-diodooctane
conferenceTitle: 2016 Progress in Electromagnetic Research Symposium (PIERS)
abstract: In this work, we investigate the effect of a solvent additive, 1,8-diodooctane (DIO), in a bodipy-based bulk-heterojunction solar cells. By using 0.2 vol% DIO, the power conversion efficiency (PCE) increased from 1.97% to 2.49%. This improvement was mostly due to the increase in the fill factor. The effect of solvent additive on photophysical property and microscopic morphology of the device is also discussed.

title: A flexible, ethernet fronthaul for 5th generation mobile and beyond
conferenceTitle: 2016 Optical Fiber Communications Conference and Exhibition (OFC)
abstract: Using Ethernet in the fronthaul can deliver the statistical multiplexing gains offered by the new functional splits proposed for the radio access network, but latency and delay variations are challenges that must be overcome.
